keyMoments.title: Tom Punches Franky and Teaches Pride
keyMoments.description: Tom punches Franky for the first time and teaches him that a shipwright must take pride in their creations no matter how they are used, establishing his core philosophy.
keyMoments.significance: This is Tom's defining moment and the most important lesson he passes on to Franky. It shapes Franky's entire worldview as a shipwright and becomes a recurring theme in his character.
keyMoments.quote: Don't ever say that about the ships you built! A ship is neither good nor evil. The ship isn't at fault. The men who use it are!

keyMoments.title: Tom's Ultimate Sacrifice
keyMoments.description: Tom accepts the death penalty for both his original crime and the false accusation, sacrificing himself to save Franky and Iceburg from being taken to Enies Lobby.
keyMoments.significance: Tom's final act demonstrates his unconditional love for his apprentices and his willingness to die to protect them. It's the climax of his character arc and leaves a lasting impact on both Franky and Iceburg.
keyMoments.quote: I'll take responsibility for everything! I built a ship for the Pirate King, and I'm proud of it! I'll accept my punishment!

relationships.description: Tom adopted and trained Franky as a shipwright apprentice. Their bond was like father and son, with Tom ultimately sacrificing his life to protect Franky.

evolutionMoments.description: Tom punches Franky for the first time and teaches him the most important lesson about taking pride in one's work.
Tom sacrifices himself to save Franky from prosecution, demonstrating his parental love.

relationships.description: Tom trained Iceburg as his first apprentice and entrusted him with the Pluton blueprints.

evolutionMoments.description: Tom's sacrifice to save both Iceburg and Franky cements his role as their father figure.

reveals.information: Tom accepts execution to save his apprentices and is taken to Enies Lobby
Tom's philosophy that shipwrights must take pride in their creations regardless of how they are used

keyMoments.title: Franky Learns Tom's Philosophy
keyMoments.description: Tom punches Franky and teaches him that a shipwright must take pride in all their creations, a lesson that becomes the foundation of Franky's character.
keyMoments.significance: This lesson shapes Franky's entire worldview and explains his actions throughout the series, particularly his relationship with the Thousand Sunny.

keyMoments.title: Franky Attacks Spandam
keyMoments.description: Overcome with rage, Franky grabs a pistol and brutally attacks Spandam, permanently disfiguring his face and making himself a wanted criminal.
keyMoments.significance: This violent act undermines Tom's sacrifice and turns Franky into a fugitive. It also establishes the deep grudge between Franky and Spandam that persists into the present day.
keyMoments.quote: You bastard! This is all your fault!

keyMoments.title: Franky Attempts to Stop the Sea Train
keyMoments.description: In a desperate attempt to save Tom, Franky positions himself on the tracks and tries to stop the Puffing Tom with his bare hands.
keyMoments.significance: This desperate act demonstrates Franky's love for Tom and his willingness to die to save his mentor. It sets up his near-death experience.
keyMoments.quote: Puffing Tom! Don't take your creator away! Stop!

keyMoments.title: Franky Hit by Sea Train
keyMoments.description: The Puffing Tom runs over Franky, causing catastrophic injuries that leave him for dead and later force him to rebuild himself as a cyborg.
keyMoments.significance: This is the transformative event that explains Franky's cyborg nature and marks the symbolic death of his old self. Being run over by Tom's creation represents the tragedy of his rage betraying Tom's teachings.

bounties.reason: Not yet wanted until after attacking Spandam

relationships.description: Franky was Tom's apprentice and viewed him as a father figure. Tom's death became the defining trauma of Franky's life.

evolutionMoments.description: Tom teaches Franky his most important lesson about pride, cementing their mentor-student bond.
Franky's inability to save Tom and his near-death trying to stop the train create a lasting trauma.

relationships.description: Spandam framed Tom, leading Franky to attack him and create a lasting grudge between them.

evolutionMoments.description: Franky violently attacks Spandam, disfiguring his face and establishing their enmity.

relationships.description: Fellow apprentice under Tom, they share the trauma of losing their mentor.

evolutionMoments.description: Both witness Tom's sacrifice together, bonding them through shared tragedy.

reveals.information: Franky's transformation into a cyborg was caused by being run over by the Sea Train while trying to save Tom
Franky attacked and disfigured Spandam eight years ago, creating their mutual hatred

keyMoments.title: Spandam Frames Tom's Workers
keyMoments.description: Spandam orchestrates a conspiracy using Franky's Battle Franky ships to attack a judicial ship and frame Tom's Workers.
keyMoments.significance: This reveals Spandam's manipulative nature and willingness to frame innocent people to achieve his goals. It establishes him as a corrupt government agent.
keyMoments.quote: Tom and his workers are the ones who attacked the judicial ship!

keyMoments.title: Franky Disfigures Spandam's Face
keyMoments.description: Franky attacks Spandam with a pistol, permanently scarring his face and creating a lasting grudge.
keyMoments.significance: This explains Spandam's facial scars and his deep hatred of Franky. The disfigurement becomes a constant reminder of his failure and humiliation.

keyMoments.title: Spandam Reveals Himself to Franky
keyMoments.description: In the present day, Spandam reveals that he has been promoted to CP9 chief and still seeks revenge on Franky.
keyMoments.significance: This connects the flashback to the present, showing that Spandam has risen in power and the conflict remains unresolved.
keyMoments.quote: Long time no see, Cutty Flam. Or should I call you Franky now?

relationships.description: Spandam framed Tom and was subsequently attacked and disfigured by Franky, creating a deep mutual hatred.

evolutionMoments.description: Spandam frames Tom, leading to Tom's execution and Franky's transformation.
Franky disfigures Spandam's face, intensifying their enmity.

relationships.description: Spandam framed Tom to obtain the Pluton blueprints, leading to Tom's execution.

reveals.information: Spandam was the CP5 leader who framed Tom eight years ago and has since been promoted to CP9 chief
Spandam's facial scars were caused by Franky's attack with a pistol

keyMoments.title: Witnesses Tom's Sacrifice
keyMoments.description: Iceburg watches helplessly as Tom sacrifices himself to save both him and Franky from being taken to Enies Lobby.
keyMoments.significance: This traumatic event shapes Iceburg's character and his determination to protect Tom's legacy and the Pluton blueprints.

keyMoments.title: Tells Franky to Run
keyMoments.description: After Franky attacks Spandam, Iceburg tells him to flee before he's captured.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Iceburg's concern for his fellow apprentice even in the midst of tragedy.

relationships.description: Tom was Iceburg's master and father figure, entrusting him with the Pluton blueprints.

evolutionMoments.description: Iceburg witnesses Tom's sacrifice, cementing Tom's role as his greatest influence.

relationships.description: Fellow apprentice under Tom, they share the trauma of losing their mentor.

evolutionMoments.description: Both witness Tom's sacrifice together, bonding them through shared tragedy.

keyMoments.title: Judge Jorge Presides Over Tom's Trial
keyMoments.description: Judge Jorge accepts Tom's confession and agrees to take only Tom to Enies Lobby for execution while pardoning Iceburg and Franky.
keyMoments.significance: Jorge represents the judicial system that ultimately fails Tom, accepting Spandam's framing and sending an innocent man to his death.
